slides.title: JavaScript Fundamentals
slides.subtitle: An Introduction to the Language of the Web

list.text: Variables & Data Types - Storing and using data
Control Flow - Making decisions in your code
The language of the web - Runs in all modern browsers
Versatile - Used for frontend, backend, mobile, and more
Dynamic - No need to specify data types
1995 - Created by Brendan Eich at Netscape
2009 - Node.js allows JavaScript to run on servers
Null & Undefined: typeof null is object, typeof undefined is undefined

box.code:
let x = 10;
let y = 5;

console.log(x + y); // 15
console.log(x - y); // 5
console.log(x * y); // 50
console.log(x / y); // 2
console.log(x % y); // 0
console.log(x ** y); // 100000

// Comparison
console.log(10 == "10"); // true (loose equality)
console.log(10 === "10"); // false (strict equality)
console.log(10 != "10"); // false
console.log(10 !== "10"); // true
console.log(10 > 5); // true

// Logical
console.log(true && false); // false
console.log(true || false); // true
console.log(!true); // false
